greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n*n', where n' is the arithmetic derivative (A003415) of n.
comment: Sequence is not injective. 4153248 is the smallest number that occurs more than once, as a(1368) and as a(2277). See example in A327861. - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 29 2019
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: A003415[n_]:= If[Abs@n < 2, 0, n Total[#2/#1 & @@@FactorInteger[Abs@n]]]; Table[n*A003415[n], {n, 1, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 29 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = n*sum(i=1, #f=factor(n)~, n/f[1, i]*f[2, i]); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 30 2017
xref: Cf. A003415, A327861 (number of times n occurs in this sequence).
results.author: _Giorgio Balzarotti_, May 04 2011
